column1: Vetapalem is a census town in Prakasam district of the Indian state of Andhra Pradesh. It is the mandal headquarters of Vetapalem mandal in Ongole revenue division.

column3: 671. Males constituted 49% of the population and females 51%. Vetapalem had an average literacy rate of 59%
column4: lower than the national average of 59.5%: male literacy was 68%
column5: and female literacy was 50%. In Vetapalem
column6: 11% of the population was under 6 years of age.

column1: Vetapalem gram panchayat is the local self-government of the town. The elected members of the gram panchayat are headed by a sarpanch.
The primary and secondary school education is imparted by government
column3: under the School Education Department of the state. Schools use English and Telugu as the medium of instruction.
